visualization_prompt: Generate a 3D column chart showing fruit consumption comparison between two individuals using depth-enhanced 3D rendering with statistical coherence in synthetic data extension
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two quantitative series (kg consumption) across 10 categorical fruit types. Synthetic data extends the original 7 categories to 10 using domain-appropriate produce, maintaining original consumption patterns through normal distribution parameters (Female: μ=2.8±1.6, Male: μ=4.5±2.1). The 3D column chart leverages z-axis depth to enhance categorical separation while maintaining Tufte's data-ink ratio through restrained shadow effects. Cairo's perceptual topology principles are applied through color contrast (#7cb5ec vs #434348) and proportional depth scaling, enabling accurate pattern recognition despite 3D presentation. Statistical coherence is maintained through synthetic variance modeling matching original data's distribution characteristics.
